sources.note: Main corporate site. NaphCare is a correctional healthcare services company (founded 1989, ~6,000 employees). Serves local/state/federal correctional facilities. Provides medical, mental health, pharmacy, dialysis, telehealth, forensic services, and TechCare EHR.

Services page detailing medical/mental health (Proactive Care model), pharmacy (NaphCare Rx), dialysis, STATCare 24/7 telehealth, MAT, forensic services (THRIVE), TechCare EHR, MyCare portal, and administrative services (claims, provider networks, scheduling).

ONC mandatory disclosures page. Sparse content — describes TechCare as 'corrections specific EHR system and hosted solutions' customized for each correctional system. NASPO member. No detailed feature list or cost/limitation specifics visible in page content.
TechCare product site. Very minimal content — landing page with basic description of corrections-specific EHR and hosted solutions. No detailed feature documentation publicly accessible.

Carahsoft (government IT reseller) product page. Most detailed feature description found: all modules built into product, scales with facility demands, consolidates offender management/lab/pharmacy/radiology/food service/kiosks/hospital referrals/Medicaid into one system. Supports chart audits, litigation, real-time tracking.

NMCD deployment announcement. Details integrations: offender management, pharmacy, lab, radiology, immunization registry, state HIE. 5,800 residents, all state prisons. MyCare portal and Power BI dashboards featured.
TechCare GO announcement (Sept 2025). Browser-based offline medication administration module. Preloaded patient lists, sync on reconnection, activity tracking, compliance audit trails.
20th anniversary article (2024). History: launched 2004 as first corrections-specific EHR. 229 facilities, 154,000+ daily records. Mentions emerging AI, chatbots, visual analytics capabilities.
Georgia DOC deployment: 62 facilities, 41,000+ patient records, 1,700+ staff trained. Describes TechCare as 'whole person healthcare operating system.' MyCare portal and Power BI dashboards included.

Black Book Research 2026 Top-Rated EHR Vendor for Correctional Facilities. Based on evaluation of 239 EHR brands. Notes 'secure workflows and documentation controls tailored to correctional care environments.'
ONC certification announcement for TechCare 5.0 via Drummond Group. At time of announcement: 160+ facilities, 126,000+ daily records.

TechCare BI announcement. Eight specific dashboards detailed: Intake Compliance, Detox, Pharmacy Active Orders, Completed Sick Calls, Monthly HSR, Daily HSR, Offsite Reporting, NaphCare University Compliance.
Company overview article. Mentions AI engines, chatbots, visual data analytics as emerging capabilities. Confirms family-owned, ~6,000 employees.

HealthcareTechOutlook 2015 profile. Most specific feature details: MAR integration, centralized diagnostics, intake assessments, discharge coordination. Notes system eliminates 'unnecessary free-world processes' for corrections focus. Stores demographics, medical history (including prior incarcerations), diagnostics, medications, encounters, compliance records.
LeadIQ company profile. Noted in search results: ~6,000 employees, $250M-$500M revenue range.
